publicationStmt.p: Digital edition hosted on http://rickandmorty.newtfire.org and GitHub: https://github.com/dorothealint/Rick-and-Morty

encodingDesc.p: Some small changes to the original transcriptions were made including fixed spelling errors and getting rid of parentheses, brackes, and colons.

body.stage: (Smith family is eating, Jerry checks his mail)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Steve, I just got a weird E-mail. Did you buy us airline tickets?

sp.speaker: Uncle Steve
sp.p: : Aw shoot, it was supposed to be a surprise! I wanted to thank you for letting me live here all this time, so I'm treating the family to a vacation!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Steve, you're so sweet!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Thanks Uncle Steve!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Best uncle ever!

sp.speaker: Uncle Steve
sp.p: : Look out world, the Smith family is goin' to Paris!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: :(Offscreen) Yeah! Awesome!

body.stage: (Rick enters the room, and dumps some very familiar-looking rocks into the kitchen trash)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Rick, I don't like glowing rocks in the kitchen trash.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well I don't like your unemployed genes in my grandchildren, Jerry. But life is made of little concessions.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I, you know what, I-

sp.speaker: Uncle Steve
sp.p: : You're gonna land on your feet Jer. Some company out there's gonna think they're lucky stars they hired my little brother.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Who the fuck are you?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : My goofy brother Steve. He's been living here almost a year now, are you losing your mind?

sp.speaker: Uncle Steve
sp.p: : Hey someone's been spending too much time around glowing rocks am I right? (Everybody except Rick laughs, Rick shoots Steve in the head)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What the hell, Rick? What the hell?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Everybody just relax for a second. There's no such thing as an "Uncle Steve". That is an alien parasite.

body.stage: (Uncle Steve turns back into his true form and dies)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : But I've known him my whole life!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No you haven't Jerry. These telepathic little bastards, they embed themselves in memories they use those to multiply, spread out, and take over planets. It's disgusting.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Steve wasn't real?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : He's a real piece of shit! This is a big one, someone probably tracked in last week on the bottom of their shoe or on a piece of alien fruit.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Someone?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Get off the high road Summer, we all got pink eye because you won't stop texting on the toilet.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : But Uncle Steve taught me how to ride a bike.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No, "Steve" put that memory in your brain so he could live in your house, eat your food, and multiply. We could be infested with these things, so we gotta keep an eye out for any zany, wacky characters that pop up.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Oh wee, whatever you want Rick, we're here to help!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Thanks Mr. Poopybutthole. I always could count on you.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Alright, there's six of us and that's it. Me, Morty, Jerry, Beth, Mr. Poopybutthole, and Summer.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Maybe you got the first one in time Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Can't afford to chance it.

body.stage: (Rick presses a button on his watch, all doors and windows in the house are sealed off by blast shields)

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Dad, why does our house have blast shields?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Trust me Beth you don't wanna know how many answers that question has.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Ooh, gosh, it feels claustrophobic! Reminds me of that time we all got stuck in the elevator together. Y-- remember that? After "the hulk" musical? (Flashback, Jerry grunting, muzak playing )

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Jerry, buttons don't work better if you hit them harder, and foam fists don't make you strong.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I know. Friends make you strong. I watched the same musical you did.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Why couldn't I bring my portal gun? (Morty winces )

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Why did all the drinks have to be extra large? Oh, the hulk. I just got that.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Just pee your pants. I did it the minute we got stuck. Oh, oh, yeah, yeah, shame me. At least when I'm disgusting, it's on purpose.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Oh, y'all, we're gonna be fine. I've always been here for you guys, and I always will be. ( chuckles )

sp.speaker: Nicky
sp.p: : somebody call for repairs?

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Yay! Cousin Nicky!

sp.speaker: Nicky
sp.p: : It's me, cousin Nicky. I'm walkin' here! I mean, I'm not. I'm crouched in the elevator shaft, but hey, I'm walkin' here! ( laughter ) (Cut back to the present) It's true. We really do get into some crazy situations as a family, mostly when we're cooped up like this. Hey, maybe Mr. Poopypants is right. L-let's get some fresh air.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Come on, cousin Nicky. You heard Rick. We have to stay quarantined until we know that there's no more of these things.

sp.speaker: Nicky
sp.p: : I hear you, Morty. Back in brooklyn, we got a sayin' -- "we're walkin' here!" ( laughter )

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Nicky! (Rick shoots Nicky in the shoulder, and he reverts back into a parasite)

sp.speaker: Nicky
sp.p: : Oh! ( gasps ) ( groaning )

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : What the...? Cousin Nicky was a parasite?!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Six, Morty! There's supposed to be six of us! If there's seven, then that means somebody's not real.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : But how did you know it was Nicky?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I guessed. That's why I aimed for his shoulder.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : So we can't trust any of our memories now? Nicky was the reason we found that old nazi submarine. Did that not even happen?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Well, of course it happened.

body.stage: (Flashback, Morty, Rick, Jerry, Beth and Nicky are tied up, a Nazi stands before them)

sp.speaker: Nazi
sp.p: : Now that I possess the mighty staff of Rah-gubaba, the world will tremble before the fourth reich!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : This is the last time I ask you for help on my history final, Rick.

sp.speaker: Nicky
sp.p: : Hey, we got a word for nazis back in Brooklyn, pal.

sp.speaker: Nazi
sp.p: : I'm comfortable being called a nazi. You think there's some other word that will hurt my feelings? (Hits Nicky on the head) Yeah. Think before you talk shit. Rah-gubaba, help me kill america! (Mr. Beauregard knocks out the nazi)

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Mr. Beauregard!

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : After due consideration, I have elected not to retire.

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Yeah! Oh, thank god!

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : Now, I believe someone has a final exam to attend. Set a course for Morty's high school. (Return to the present) Perhaps I'm biased, but if that story never happened, then I wouldn't still be the family butler. ( chuckles ) dare to dream.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wait.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : And if Mr. Beauregard wasn't our butler, it's safe to say the family'd be in a hell of a lot of trouble. ( laughter )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No! Don't flashback!

body.stage: (Flashbacks, Jerry has his head stuck in the staircase railing)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You're just gonna make more swelling.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Don't worry, Jerry. Just relax. We called the fire department.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : You know they won't come here anymore. ( grunting ) (Mr. Beauregard pours marmalade on Jerry, all gasp )

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : Marmalade is served. (everybody cheers)

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : I guess I take back what I said about British cuisine. ( laughter )

body.stage: (Rick, Summer, and Mr. Beauregard are having a pillow fight)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Take that!

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : We're trying to sleep.

body.stage: (Morty is in the living room with Beth, Jerry, and Sleepy Gary)

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I don't want to go to the dance alone.

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: (Off-screen): Then perhaps, you shouldn't.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Aww. Mr. Beauregard.

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : Shall we, master Morty?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : We shall.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh, wait, don't leave without letting photography raptor take a picture. ( raptor screeches ) ( camera shutter clicks ) ( cut back to the present, laughter )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Everybody stop remembering! These parasites are like bed bugs, and every flashback is another mattress. Look! There's only supposed to be six people in this house.
But there's always been 10.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No! Uh, the fact that I wrote this number down means that there's four parasites.

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : You sure about that, Rick?

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : Begging your pardon, master Rick, but I seem to recall a great deal of confusion surrounding that number.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : All right, there's six of us, ( belches ) and that's it. Me, Morty, Jerry, Beth, Mr. Poopybutthole, Frankenstein, Sleepy Gary, Photography raptor, Mr. Beauregard, and Summer.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Uh, dad, that's like 10 people.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : 6, 10, what's the difference? I just love the number 6 for no reason! Where's my pencil at?

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : Right here, Rick! Use me!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, thanks, Pencilvester! (writes the number 6 again) Yeah,I-I g-- I guess that is what happened, but I-I don't get why I would do that.

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : Everybody makes mistakes, Rick. Why do you think I have one of these? ( laughter, camera shutter clicks )

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : That's it. Photos. Hard evidence. (Beth scrolls through photos, becomes suspicious) You're not in any of my photos, Mr. Poopybutthole.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Well, what do you know about this? You're not in any of mine.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : All I have are pictures of me and my friends from school. (everybody else stares at Summer) What? What teenage girl has pictures of her family? It's not like we're mormon or dying.

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : I will admit it's suspicious that Summer's only friend is a magic ballerina lamb that we've never seen.

sp.speaker: Tinkles
sp.p: : Summer!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Tinkles! It's past my bedtime.

sp.speaker: Tinkles
sp.p: : ( giggles ) Not in never past bedtime land! Here we go! ♪ Summer and Tinkles ♪ ♪ friends with each other ♪ ♪ living in never past bedtime land ♪ ♪ no kitchen sinkles ♪ ♪ no little brother ♪ ♪ going to raves and waving our hands ♪ (Rapper rapping ) ♪ Summer and tinkle, friends to the end ♪ ♪ group text the whole crew, my mother... Friends! ♪ ♪ ketchup to the salt, salt to the fry ♪ ♪ "t" to the "inkle" with a capital "I" ♪

body.stage: (Scene cut's back to Summer's Bedroom, revealing that she was only dreaming)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Ooh! Ooh! Ooh! Ooh! Ooh! Ooh! Ooh!

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Summer, we're trying to sleep.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : It was Tinkles! Tinkes?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : That is su-- [belches] -- suspicious. We're always hearing about this Tinkles character, but we never get to –

sp.speaker: Tinkles
sp.p: : Hi, everybody. I'm Tinkles, and these are my friends. ( all sigh )

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : See, everyone? Tinkles is real. That means so am I.

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : I was on the wrong side of the pitchfork on this one.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Okay, look, we shouldn't need evidence or logic to know who's family and who isn't. I know who the Smiths are. I've known Beth since high school. And her husband, Sleepy Gary, is hands down my absolute best friend.

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Thanks, Jerry. Beyond that, no offense to any of you, but all bets are off.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Look, I'm not used to being this unsure for this long. I'm just gonna aim for shoulders starting with the weird girl. (Tries to shoot Summer)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Aah! Grandpa Rick!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hold still, "Summer."

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Rick, that is my daughter.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, yeah? Well, what if you just think that, Sleepy Gary? I've known you for 15 years. Don't make me hurt you.

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Rick, these are our family and friends, the people we barbecue with. Have you forgotten the barbecue?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wait, why would you want me to -- You're one of them, aren't you?

sp.speaker: Hamurai
sp.p: : Rick, you love those barbecues, Rick. You love them. Hai!

sp.speaker: Amish Cyborg
sp.p: : Remember it, Rick?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Shut up, Hamurai! Shut up, Amish Cyborg! What is this? '90s Conan?

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Remember the barbecue. Remember the barbecue. Remember the barbecue.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You know what, Pencilvester? It took me my whole life to realize it, but I love barbecuing.

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : You're good at it, Rick.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Watch me, baby. I'm like tom cruise from, um, "cuisine" or w-whatever that movie's called where he makes drinks. Yeah, check me out. I'm like tom cruise from "cuisine." ( chuckles ) yeah. Is that what it's called? "cuisine"?

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : Wow! Hey, everybody. Let's give it up for the grill master, Rick! Rick! Rick! Rick! ( all chanting "Rick" )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wait. (cut back to the present, breathing heavily ) Noooooo! Shoot. Now look. It's like a "Where's Waldo?" page. Can you find me? Check out all these zany characters. We'll be right back after these messages.

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : I think you should put down the gun and we should get you to a doctor. What do you say we take down these blast shields?

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Yeah.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Can't do that, Sleepy Gary. All right, everybody listen to me. I don't know if any of you guys are real, but this house has been infested with fake loved ones that spread through fake memories, and our planet will be destroyed if they get out. ( grunts )

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : But Rick, even you have to admit you do tend to overreact to stuff.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You guys, we got to hurry. I just got back from Walmart. They're selling Nintendo 3ds systems for $149.99 on sale, plus every time you buy one, you get a $50 gift card. Brings the total price down to $110 after tax. Now, listen, we can flip those sons of bitches for 230 bucks apiece easy! They're all limited-edition "Zelda" ones. Hurry! Hurry! Come with me! We can be rich, and we also all get to keep one and we can play nintendo games! Nintendo, give me free stuff.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Okay, yes, I definitely remember doing that, but also, I would never do that

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : Don't overreact, Rick.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Sleepy Gary, a word?

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Sure, Jerry. Rick, keep a level head, okay? 'Cause I'll tell you a secret about Frankenstein -- He's actually Frankenstein's monster.

body.stage: (Rick looks at Frankenstein, Frankenstein pounds his fist)

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Sleepy Gary, m-my head is filled with memories of our friendship. I'm convinced that you're Beth's husband and I'm your friend, but if those memories can't be trusted, then...

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Jerry, just say it.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Sleepy Gary, how do we know I'm real?

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Jesus, Jerry. No, you're real. Hey, look at me. Now, I don't know which way is up out there, but I know us, and you're real, Jerry. Remember our vacation?

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : They're filming that new "Star Wars" movie down the coast. Should we check it out?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Sure. Why not? (Gary drinks, Jerry drops his bottle, both he and Gary reach for it)

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Maybe we'll see Chewbacca.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I'd like that. ( Kissing ) What are we doing?

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : I don't give a damn what else happens out there. You and I are going to survive this.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Okay. Hey, we agreed. Never in the house.

body.stage: (Transit to the living room, Rick is pointing the gun at random people)

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : That's a cool watch there, Rick. Can I check it out?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Uh, no thank -- ( grunts ) Okay. Trying to figure out how to lower the blast shields, huh? Anybody here think it's suspicious that a lot of people in here can't wait to get out of here?

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : Ah, you're paranoid, Rick. You've been paranoid since 'nam.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : So, what are you gonna do when you rotate back to the world, Frankenstein?

sp.speaker: Frankenstein
sp.p: : Shi-i-i-i-t. I'mma bust a -- ( cut back to the present, Rick grunts )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No! Get out of my head, parasite! No! Drop it. Give me the gun, Frankenstein! ( indistinct shouting ) Give it back!

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : Yeah! ( applause ) Frankenstein!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : ( breathing heavily ) Is anyone here even real? Am I the only real person on earth?!

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : Maybe. Or maybe, just maybe, we're all real. You know me. I'm reverse giraffe. I have a short neck and legs. I went to college with Hamurai.

sp.speaker: Hamurai
sp.p: : Hai!

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : I saved Ghost In A Jar's life in Vietnam.

sp.speaker: Ghost in a Jar
sp.p: : Boo rah!

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : And Beth, how many times have I been a shoulder for you to cry on?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : ( sighs ) Too many.

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : Okay, so maybe we're just all fake.

sp.speaker: Mrs. Refrigerator
sp.p: : That don't make no sense!

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : Or maybe, there's only one deceiver here -- The person that keeps telling us the path to salvation is being held prisoner and mistrusting each other.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Hey, don't blame me! I tried to shoot Summer 10 minutes ago!

sp.speaker: Reverse Giraffe
sp.p: : I know we all have beloved memories of Rick, but are we really supposed to believe that a mad scientist inventor with a flying car just showed up on our doorstep after being gone for years?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Yeah, you know, he does have a lot of really weird, made-up sounding catchphrases.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Wubba lubba dub dub! Ricky ticky tavi, beyotch! And that's the wa-a-a-a-y the news goes. Hit the sack, jack. Uh-oh! Somersault jump. Aids! And that's why I always say shum shum shlippedy dop! Grassss tastes bad-ah. No jumpin' in the sewer. Burger time! Rubber baby baby bunkers! Lick, lick, lick my balls! ( laughs ) yeah! Say that all the time.

sp.speaker: All
sp.p: : ( muttering ) That's a fake-ass catchphrase right there.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : And don't forget his incredibly vague back story.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Beth, I'm your father!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh, are you, dad? Are you?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Rick, if you want to prove you're real, just do what any of the rest of us would do and -- and -- and open the blast shields and let us the hell out of here!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Why don't you make me, implausibly naive pubescent boy with an old Jewish comedy writer's name?

sp.speaker: Mrs. Refrigerator
sp.p: : In your face!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Give me the gun. (Looks at everyone else) I'm not doing this in front of Pencilvester. Bring him to the garage. ( all cheering ) All right, you listen to me, you son of a bitch parasite scum. We could either do this the easy way or the hard way. You know, y-y-y-- do you want to live? Then open the blast shield doors.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Shut up, Morty, you brainwashed, little turd that might not even be real because I'm brainwashed, too.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : You know, Rick, this isn't easy for us. You know, w-we all remember you as a friend.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, oh, oh, really? Well, I remember you as a whiny, little piece of shit, Morty!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Oh -- oh, yeah?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Yeah! I've got about a thousand memories of your dumb, little ass and about six of them are pleasant. The rest is annoying garbage. So why don't you do us both a favor and pull the trigger? Do it! Do it, mother[bleep] Pull the [bleep] trigger!

body.stage: (Morty shoots Baby Wizard, Baby Wizard screeches )

sp.speaker: Duck with Muscles
sp.p: : Oh, wow. Baby Wizard was a parasite? He set me up with my wife.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : What the hell?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I figured it out, Rick! The parasites can only create pleasant memories. I know you're real because I have a ton of bad memories with you!

body.stage: (Flashbacks of times where Rick left Morty in depair) ♪ these memories that we have ♪ ♪ these memories that we cherish ♪ ♪ I wish that we... can go back... to that time ♪ ♪ ooh, ooh, ooh ♪

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Holy crap, Morty, you're right.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Is -- is -- isn't that what you were trying to make me understand by yelling at me?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Well, yeah, duh-doy. T-took you long enough. (Rick turns the dial on the washing machine, the wall draws back to reveal a set of guns)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Now let's go, Morty. We got a lot of friends and family to exterminate. ( grunts )

body.stage: (Rick shoots a parasite, everybody else screams )

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Everybody remain calm! This is gonna take some explaining.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : We need to kill everyone that we can only remember fondly. Who's got a bad memory about Mrs. Refrigerator?

sp.speaker: Mrs. Refrigerator
sp.p: : I-I-I-I -- everyone has bad memories of me. You remember that one time? (flashback, Beth, Jerry, Mrs. Refrigerator and a lot of other people on a roller coaster, screaming, cut back to the present) Ooh, man, we couldn't stop screaming.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Uh, roller coasters aren't bad, Mrs. Refrigerator. They're thrilling. And you've been a perfect companion to me my entire life.

sp.speaker: Mrs. Refrigerator
sp.p: : The jig is up! ( whimpering ) get me out of here. Get me out of here! Aah! ( screeching ) ( all gasping ) Oh [bleep]

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Everybody back! If you're not a parasite, you have nothing to fear. What about Summer?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Why am I always your go-to?

body.stage: (Flashback, Morty is hosing the backyard, Summer grunts and kicks him in the crotch, Morty whimpers )

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Never go in my room again.

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I didn't! (Cut back to the present) She's real. She's my bitch of a sister.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Nice. (Flashback) Mom, are you driving me to --

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Hmm? Yeah, yeah, yes. What time?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, my god. Are you drunk?

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : ( belches ) * slurring * What're you, my life coach?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Your what? Oh! God! Oh. Oh, my gosh. Oh! God! Mom!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Sweetheart, are you okay? I didn't mean to --

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : I'm gonna have a bruise! It's picture day!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : It's not, don't overreact. I can clean it up.

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : ( sobs ) I want the police to take me!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Morty, give a gun to the lady that got pregnant with me too early and constantly makes it our problem.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Thank you, sweetie.

sp.speaker: Cross Teddy Bear
sp.p: : Beth, Beth, please!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I thought it was too good to be true that we'd have compatible kidneys. (shoots the bear, parasite screeches ) ( guns cock ) ( screaming ) ( blasting ) ( screeching )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : (Corners Pencilvester) Come on, man. Haven't we ever had an uncomfortable silence or an awkward fart on a road trip? Come on, Pencilvester. Give me anything.

sp.speaker: Pencilvester
sp.p: : Rick, I'm Pencilvester. Listen to that name. You can't kill me.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : You're right. (To Morty) Kill Pencilvester.

body.stage: (Morty shoots Pencilvester, parasite screeches ) (Summer shoots Frankenstein, parasite screeches ) (Summer shooting, parasites screeching )

sp.speaker: Tinkles
sp.p: : Summer, I've always loved you!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Yep. (Shoots Tinkles, parasite screeches ) ( all gasp, Summer shoots ) ( more screeching ) (Morty shouts)

body.stage: (Flashback, Summer walks into the kitchen and turns on the light, and sees Morty masturbating)

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, my god!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I-I-I thought you went to a concert!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : We forgot the tickets! Why in the kitchen?!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I do it everywhere! Stop shaming me!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : You're not the victim here!

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : I hate you, and I was thinking about your friend Grace!

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Aaaaaah! (cut back to the present, more shooting, parasites screeching )

sp.speaker: Mr. Beauregard
sp.p: : Ah. Master Rick. Remember when you weren't going to shoot me? (Rick shoots Mr. Beauregard, parasite screeches )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : I guess I did the butler! Ha ha! Does -- d-does that scan?

sp.speaker: Ghost in a Jar
sp.p: : Oh, I-I get it. It's a play on "the butler did it."

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Thanks, ghost in a jar. You always were good at pointing out potentially obscure comedy. (shoots ghost in a jar, parasite screeches ) ( screeches )

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : You got to hide me, Sleepy Gary.

sp.speaker: Sleepy Gary
sp.p: : Don't worry. I have a plan. If we can get to my boat, there's a -- (Beth shoots Sleepy Gary, Gary slowly turns back into a parasite, screeches )

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : No. No! Send me to Gary. I want to be with Gary. (Flashback, Jerry is running away from a hobo)

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Whoa. What the hell?

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Look out for that homeless guy!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Open the door! Open the door! Open the door!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : There isn't time! Just run!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : ( grunts ) Get out here and help me!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : They say you shouldn't do that! Just run!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Ugh. Sorry, Jerry. You're real.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : ( crying ) I'm a parasite!

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Yeah, but you're real.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : (tries to kiss Beth)

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Uh, uh, I need time to forget about Sleepy Gary.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : Me, too. ( Rick opens the blast shields )

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : From now on, let's all be careful to wash our hands when we get back from outer space. That goes for everyone.

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : This is depressing. We killed every good person in the house. We're what's left? What a family.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : At least we're real, Jerry. We're real. Ricky ticky tavi!

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Ooh, whee! Amen to that. Now, this little poopypants is hungry. Will somebody pass me a pork chop? ( chomping )

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Huh. I-is -- is something wrong, Beth? (Beth shoots Mr. Poopybutthole) Ow! ( screams ) oh, my god!

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : No, Beth! Oh [bleep]

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Wait, but I --

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Oh, Beth! Why?!

sp.speaker: Jerry
sp.p: : I need an ambulance! There's been a shooting. My wife shot... Uh, my -- my wife shot a long-time family friend.

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Why?

sp.speaker: Summer
sp.p: : Oh, my god, oh, my god, oh, my god, Mr. Poopybutthole.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : I-I thought --

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Keep breathing!

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Oh, god. What's happening?

sp.speaker: Morty
sp.p: : Look at me! Look at me! Don't -- don't fall asleep!

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Is -- is this what bleeding to death is? Oh, whee. Is this how I die?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Oh, geez! Oh, my god!

sp.speaker: Mr. Poopybutthole
sp.p: : Why would you do this? Beth. It's not supposed to hurt. I-I thought... ( siren wails ) Ooh, whee.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Oh, he -- he's looking a lot better.

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : Listen, Beth, don't torture yourself. I made a similar mistake years ago, but, you know, on a planetary scale.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Is, um, is he mad at me?

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : He's not pressing charges. I mean, that's got to be the "you shot me" equivalent of not being mad.

sp.speaker: Beth
sp.p: : Can he have visitors?

sp.speaker: Doctor
sp.p: : He'd like to be alone. He told me to tell you he's sorry you didn't have bad memories of him? If you love him, you should leave. ( door closes )

body.stage: (Smith family walks out of the hospital)

sp.speaker: Rick
sp.p: : (Smiles) And that's the wa-a-a-a-y the news goes.
